column4: !lamp > rob_    (rob_, see the private message from Ubotu) | isn't centered on server edition.
MySQL AND PostGRE? lol
gcc isn't in /usr/lib.
mine is lol
i doubt it. what's the output of  apt-cache policy gcc | grep Installed  ?
you can run that command even with no networking.
how have you installed GCC?
its in the initial Ubuntu install
uhm, no it isn't (not if you installed the normal Desktop version at any rate). no compiler is installed by default.
above ^^
well, then if they really are installed, there's something quite wrong, because "whereis gcc" should *definitely* give "/usr/bin/gcc"
what about the output of  dpkg -L gcc | grep bin  ? does it show anything?
I thought it'd be there too
lemme check
well, whatever the reason why it's not there is, the right solution is *not* to change your path. besides, /usr/lib/gcc isn't even a file, it's a directory.
it says no
it says what?
EH!?
get the package
err, then how are you even going to get the tarball?
a .deb file isn't any harder to get then a tarball
DL it here and throw it on a jumpdrive
and why can't you do it with the proper package, in a sane way?
cuz I suck like that lol
